page.title: 12TWO POST HOUSES, SHERBORNE
page.content:
{HISTORY:}In 17th century the Old Post House was built for stages to change horses and to let the passengers rest. The Post House was on two main roads Bath to Dorchester and Exeter to London. The railway superseded the stage so the Post House closed down.
{THE MODERN POST HOUSE FORTE:}Is built to a modern design. It was completed on the 20th Feb 1969. The hotel was built with the best materials of the time. It employs 36 staff. The sort of people who stay at the hotel are old people, businessmen and tourists. The average cost to stay a night at the POST HOUSE is Â£39.00, and the average cost of a meal is Â£8.95 .
